result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam A. Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Report to Jail (Misdemeanor), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.425(1r)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
With Huber and Good Time Credit.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adam A. Brown

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 1:05 pm cases called-15CM307 & 16CM188. Defendant Adam A. Brown in court with attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement stated on the record by ADA Anderson. State moves to amend Count 2 in 16CM188 to Violating a State Law governing a county institution-946.73-Class C Misd.   Defendant advised of permissible punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to Count 1 of 15CM307 & amended Count 2 of 16CM188.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses and reads-in Count 1 of 16CM188 and dismisses the repeater enhancer on 16CM188 Count 2. Sentencing argument by ADA Anderson. Sentencing argument by Attorney Zamzow. Statement by defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: 15CM307-60 days WCJ with Huber and Good Time Credit. Credit for 1 day time served. To begin no later than October 15, 2016. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. 16CM188-30 days WCJ, concurrent to 15CM307. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan.  DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 25, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow in court appears telephonically.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Zamzow requesting a plea/sentencing hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 25, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Status conference on July 25, 2016 at 03:35 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Zamzow states offer has been exchanged-requests additional status in 30 days.  Status conference scheduled for July 25, 2016 at 03:35 pm.
Status conference on June 28, 2016 at 10:10 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Zamzow makes a statement and request further status.  Status conference scheduled for June 28, 2016 at 10:10 am.
Status conference on May 31, 2016 at 10:05 am.

Case Called @ 1:08 PM: Defendant Adam A. Brown in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Defendant Adam A. Brown in custody.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Ruth Zouski, Corporation Counsel also present for the County as to unpaid financial obligations.   15CM-307:   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Per SPD:  Eligibility confirmed.  ADA requests the Court address the contempt issues as to unpaid fine before arguing as to bond request.  Court addresses FTP issues with Def.  The Court understands that only $139.50 has been paid on these obligations, some of which are over 5 yrs old.  Statement by Corp Counsel as to unpaid PP obligations.  No payments in 2014 - few payments in 2015 - contempt of 120 days ordered w/Purge conditions to commence 6/1/2015 - $100 per mo PP - her position that the stay should be lifted and Def should serve the 120 days or make a substantial payment.  Statement by Def:  States he had indicated to the COC that he could pay approx $500.  Def did post $193 last night as to 15CM-151.  The Court:  Lifts the stay of contempt sentence due to the muliple opportunities given for payment.  Stay vacated and will require the 120 days to be served.  Sentence to be served forthwith unless full payment is owed.  Alternative will be considered upon a payment being made.  ADA argues for $1000 Signature Bond.  No objection by SPD to bond request.  NGP received and entered.   The Court orders a $500 Signature Bond.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for May 31, 2016 at 10:05 am.
